heading: ʻOku tohi ʻa Molonai ke ʻaonga ki he kau Leimaná—Ko e kau Nīfai ʻe ʻikai te nau fakaʻikaiʻi ʻa Kalaisí ʻoku tāmateʻi ʻa kinautolu. Taʻu T.S. 401–421 nai.

verses.txt: KO ʻeni ko au, Molonai, hili ʻeku fakaʻosi ʻa e hiki fakanounou ʻo e fakamatala ʻo e kakai ʻo Sēletí, naʻá ku mahalo ʻe ʻikai te u tohi mo ha toe meʻa kehe, ka ʻoku teʻeki ai te u mate; pea ʻoku ʻikai te u fakahā au ki he kau Leimaná telia naʻa nau fakaʻauha au.
He vakai, ko ʻenau ngaahi fetauʻakí ʻoku fuʻu fakamanavahē ʻaupito ʻiate kinautolu; pea koeʻuhi ko ʻenau tāufehiʻá ʻoku nau tāmateʻi ai ʻa e Nīfai kotoa pē ʻe ʻikai te ne fakaʻikaiʻi ʻa Kalaisí.
Pea ko au, Molonai, ʻe ʻikai te u fakaʻikaiʻi ʻa e Kalaisí; ko ia, ʻoku ou hē hē holo ki ha potu pē ʻoku ou faʻa ʻalu ki aí ke maluʻi ʻa ʻeku moʻui ʻaʻakú.

Ko ia, ʻoku ou tohi mo ha ngaahi meʻa siʻi ʻe niʻihi, ʻo kehe mei he meʻa ʻa ia naʻe totonu ke u faí; he naʻá ku ʻamanaki ʻe ʻikai te u tohi mo ha toe meʻa kehe; ka ʻoku ou tohi mo ha ngaahi meʻa siʻi ʻe niʻihi, heiʻilo naʻa ʻaonga ʻapē ia ki hoku kāinga, ko e kau Leimaná, ʻi ha ʻaho ʻamui, ʻo fakatatau mo e finangalo ʻo e ʻEikí.
